intro: Coprosma crassicaulis, commonly known as broad-stemmed coprosma, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, white flowers are followed by bright red berries that attract native birds. The leaves are usually glossy and oval-shaped, providing ornamental value in gardens.
